answers.answer: Hello,The bumps seem like infected hair follicles or boils. Boils are caused by infection of the hair follicle by staph aureus. Bacterial skin infections can be spread by shared cosmetics or washcloths, close human contact, or by contact with pus from a boil or carbuncle.Apply warm compresses on the bumps and keep the area clean. Also use an antibacterial soap or mild soap like dove. Avoid any kind of cosmetics. Topical antibiotics such as mupirocin or neomycin containing ointment are also useful. But make sure to consult your dermatologist before using them. Also recurrent boils are found in diabetes. So please get your blood sugar levels estimated. It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your dermatologist. Treatment can be started only when the diagnosis is confirmed. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: Im a 20 yr old femail that has a serious issue. im a vergin but has had oral sex with my one boyfriend in the past. we have not done anything in months and i havent shaved in about two months. i noticed since before thanksgiving (a few weeks back ) pimples coming and going on my lower abd region and kinda spreading down. some go away and some new ones come up... all ones i noticed have a hair growing out of the middle but i havent shaved recently. and when they first popped up i popped one and it acted just as a normal pimple. popped and bled and that one went away as a normal pimle does but why are more comming.. and there is discomfort. no open sores just pimples with a pre existing hair growing out the middle. please help!. he has gotten tested for chlamydia and gonorrhea when we first met due to a rash he had that the dr was certain was just irritated skin and they both came out negative. please help!!
title: NEED HELP odd pelvic pimples
